text: On tap. Clear golden color, white head. Aroma is malty with a hint of honey, bread and acacia flowers. Taste has clean malt and a light floral honey note. Slightly sweet overall. Light, clean and crisp mouthfeel.
Draft at Himmeriget. Pours a clear golden with a white head. Grassy, clean, extremely well done for its style.
Tap at Prague Beer Museum. Off-white head. Lots of lacing. Aroma of grain and light pils hops.
On tap at Skupinová terapia. Good lager, short white head, malty, slightly metallic aroma, clear golden colour. Slightly sour taste, malty, short finish.
Beer with medium bitterness, good volume of foam, gold color, soft carbonized, (drunk a 50cl tap beer in NaPalmě, Praha, CZ).

On tap at Himmeriget. Pours a clear golden with a medium sized milk white head. Aroma has pilsner malts, fresh, super grassy EU hops, clean and clear malty. Taste is sweet, bready, light hop bitter, clean and suuuper crisp. Really good for what it is! Average high carbonation and a light body. One of the most pleasant pilsner experiences ive had.
Keg at prague beer museum namesti miru. Pours clear golden, nose is floral, grassy, taste is sweet, lemon, floral.

On tap at Zly Casy. Pours clear golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma is fruity, with grass and hay, bready malts. Good crisp mouthfeel. Taste is well balanced, I lkie the crispy herbal citrus finish, dry and moreish, a true sessionist.
From tap at Zlý Časy with Gunnars ryk & reis. Clear golden. Bright white head and lacing. Standard, and decent, pilsner aroma and taste. Not much nore to it,

Grassy and malty aroma and taste, sweet doughy malt, hay, straw, floral and grassy hoppy into the close.

Hmm, i really enjoyed this one but Im a bit surprised about the rating here. Drank on tap at Tluska Koala in Praha, this definitely is a good and interesting one, flavour is somewhat spicy, taste is pretty sweet, its a quite good czech beer to have on tap, but not one of the best i had. I dont wanna bitch too much about it considering i thought it was very pleasant, i just think the rating here is a bit high imo, still pretty cool and definitely APPROVED BY TAVERNYS BLACK METAL CREW!

Keg @ Zly Casy. Clear pale golden, firm, lasting, white head leaving good lacing. Fruity aroma, red apple, pear, grains, grass and bread. Crisp mouthfeel, mild carbonated. Fresh fruity taste, apple, pear, citrus, bread and biscuits. Mild floral bitter finish. Very drinkable!
Capovane v Red nose pube.Farba pekna zlta,cire,biela pena.Vyssia rezkozt,horkost nizsia.Osviezujuci prijemny leziak.

150ml taster, draught at Prague Beer Museum. Patchy white head, clear straw-golden body. Spotty lacing. Grass and mid-sweet pale malty nose. Flavoured with grassy hops, honey, bread, and buttery malts. Mid-sweet malty ending with a discreet bitter touch beneath. Medium bodied. Drinks very well (01.07.2016).

Golden color, quite hazy, thick frothy head.
Aroma cereal, hay, herbal hop notes. Palate thick, medium carbonation.
At first sip sweetish, steered towards malt backbone. A little bit of sulfury overtones that are not in their 10. Finish more rounded, blended bitterness.
Not too bad, although like KOUT I prefer their 10 plato beer - its more balanced and drinkable.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2016 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours clear golden with lazing white head. Aroma is light bready malt, biscuit and a grassy hoppiness. Taste is light malts, bread and biscuit and has a semi-sweetness combined with grassy and quite bitter hoppy finish. Good one!

(Keg at Tlustá Koala as their house beer, 20160613) The beer poured golden and hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, malts and grass. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were grass, fruitiness, butter, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was grassy and bitter. GoodCzech pils.
Tap. Clear golden colour with huge head off. Aroma of malts,grain,taste almost the same, bitter finish,great lager.
From tap: golden color with thick white head, gentle malty aroma with some spicy hops and honey, thcik creamy with medium sweetness and spicy bitter hoppy finish, lively carbontation
Tap @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Light cloudy pour with a fluffy head. Grassy notes, bread crumbs, light citrus. Refreshing!

Tap @ Himmeriget. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of grassy hops, herbs, pilsner malt and nice floral notes as well. The taste has nice grassy hops which serve the rather floral profile. Also some pilsner malt and with a nice mouthfeel as well. Saaz hops keepin this 4realz.
Tap hazy golden colour with medium white head.Aroma is crispy with taste of fresh hops and caramel and citrus,nice refreshing with good malt flavor andgood mild bitterness realy tasty beer.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2016 On tap at Himmeriget. Golden with a lasting white head. Malty aroma of fresh bread and grain, with hay, grassy and herbal hops. Sweetish malty flavour with grassy and herbal hops, and a great bitter finish.
Tap @ Himmeriget. Clear golden body with a medium white head. Bread, malt, hay. Decent.
Tap @ Prague Beer Museum. Nice head with good suration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, sweet malt, fruits and has a nice semi bitter finish.
UPDATED: MAY 13, 2016 Tap at beer museum. Pours light hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of bread, chewy caramel, malts, alot of saaz, light herbal and grainy. A bit off i guess its 2-3 weeks old.
Gyllengul öl med ett gräddigt vitt skum. Doft av hö och ljusare knäckebröd. Detsamma återkommer i smaken med en gräsig beska.
Tap at zly casy, prague. Clear golden color, white head. Crispy hoppy aroma. Crispy, hoppy, some malty notes.
From tap. Clear golden color with white head. Malty grainy aroma, straw, grassy, light floral. Sweet and bitter taste. Light to medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.

(draught) clear golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of floral hops and powdered sugar, with a hint of dried fruit, some popcorn, straw and green apples. flavour is mostly herbal hops and pale malts, with more straw, some light butter and alcohol in the light-bitter finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Pivní slavnosti v Hostivici 2014. Aroma je sladové s jemným chmelovým nádechem a slabími ovocnými podtóny. Pěna je jasné bílá, jemná, vysoká a drící. Barva samotného piva je zlatá. lehce přecházející do oranova. Chuť je sladová s příjemným kvasnicovým nádechem, fini je výrazně sue hořký a drící.V ústech pivo působí plně, má střední říz a je dobře pitelné. Jedná se o dobrý světlý leák.

Grainy aromas, and a touch skunky. Perhaps not the freshest bottle. Flavour was slightly better than expected. Some sweet grainy malt with a light hoppy character. Light carbonation. Better than some of its competition, but still not great

Tap at the Prague Beer Museum at Náměstí Míru Prague. Poured a clear light amber with a frothy white head. The aroma is light zesty citrus. The flavour is medium bitter with a light fruity hop light spice pepper palate. Light bodied with average carbonation. Really liked this one. Loved the fruit hop combo with a spicy kick in the tail.
Draught at Zly Casy Prague, January 2013. Clear gold, white head. Malty and a little medicinal aroma, bitter taste with medicinal undertones. Light body, bitter finish with soft carbonation.

Decanted from a big old plastic bottle, thanks to Bruce on his home ground, 16/01/14.
Hazed golden with a moderate  white swirl that clears to the edge.
Nose is malty, bread dough, sweet notes, light grass.
Taste comprises hay, light caramel, soft bread dough, bitter twang.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, grassy bitterness in the drying closure.
Solid Czech pils, nice easy drinker.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Large PET bottle thanks to Bruce. It pours hazy golden-yellow with a small white head. The nose is doughy, buttered toast, grass, straw and white bread. The taste is crisp, grassy, straw, peppery, good bitterness, straw and mild astringency with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Crisp and pretty drinkable. Alright but doesnt excite me.

Big ass growler type juice bottle cheers to Bruce. Pours clear golden with a fat white head on top. Nose is very grassy and citric - nice lemon biscuit and cereal. Taste has plenty of biscuit, lemon tang and straw. Very crisp. Body is creamy with mild bitterness to finish. Carbonation is light and spritzy. Great Pils

16th January 2014Tasting at our ever gracious host - Bruces pad. Hazy gold beer, small.white head..Smooth palate, semi dry. Smooth malt, very light cream. Good hop bitterness. Light citric bitterness with good floral bitternes. Noble hop spice. Light finish. Pretty good and quite satisfying.

Plastic bottle shared in London - big thanks to Bruce. Pours lightly hazy gold with a creamy white head. Biscuity pale bread in the nose, straw, cereal. Light to medium sweet flavor with lovely, pale bread nose, mellow bitter hay, cereal grains. Lit bodied with average, creamy carbonation. Nice balance to finish, plenty of crisp cereal, biscuits, low bitterness. Good stuff.
Brilliant beer. Slightly golden with a thin white head. A lot of hops in aroma and in the taste, there is a lot of bread as well, the finish is bitter and long, and very good.

1,5 liters flaske delt med Ovesen tilbake fra Tsjekkia for 4 timer siden: iflg etiketten er voltstyrken på 5,1. Ufiltrert men allikevelmutseende som ufiltrert. Humlebitterheten har mer grapefrukt enn appelsin (som Benedict vi hadde først). Ellers samme hovedinntrykk: det er først når du har smakt en fersk tsjekkisk pilsner du kjenner hvilken fantastisk god og lettdrikkelig stilart dette er. En grensesettende ølopplevelse.
Draft. A yellow beer with a yellowish head. The aroma has notes of straw and hops. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw, hops, and malt, leading to a bitter finish.

(Draught at Zly Casy, Prague, 17 July 2013) Golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty nose with grass, hay, citrus and bread. Malty taste with notes of citrus, grass, toffee, bready malt and a certain grassy bitterness in the finish. Medium body, quite dry. Classic and well made Czech pilsner. Nice one.

Appearance: Clear golden color with a small white head. Some lacing.Aroma: Mild malty and mild hoppy.Palate: Medium body. Moderate sweet and a mild bitterness. Soft carbonation.Taste: Fresh mild malty and mild fresh hoppy back.Overall impression:Quite ok Czech pils.Personal stats: On tap at Hostinec Richtar Jakub in Bratislava, Slovakia.
Pours light gold with a fine white head. Aroma is floral, with light grain and spice notes. Taste is malty up front, leading to a long and nuanced hop finish. Really excellent pils!
Tap at Richtar Jakub.Golden color with medium white head. Malty aroma with bitter hops. Taste is almost the same. Drinkable.

From tap @Richtár Jakub, Bratilava. Fingerthick blond cream head. Bright yellow colorored body. Aroma is dusty and straw-scented hops, with a faint fruitiness to it. Light to medium malt body. Slightly sweet and grainy with sourish undertones. Mild bitternesss, resembling straw and earth. Smooth. Rounded bittterish ending. Harmonius and elegant. [13.04.13]
Yellow color with 2 fingers white head. Aroma of bread, earthy, grass, basement aromas. Taste is light bitter. Light body, thin to oily texture, average carbonation. Good Pilsner

Keg at Vzorkovna. Pours a slightly hazy Golden with a thick White head in to a dimpled mug. A brilliant pilsner. Aroma is bread dough and thick Flowery Saaz. Little to no sweetness and very bitter and dry on the finish. Textbook.

Uneticke pivo 12
Gylden klar skum tæt kort 
Humle citrus grape blomst malt korn 
Bitter modrat sød lidt 
Livlig 
fad aug12
645412

Draught at Tlusta Koala, Prague. This is a great, classic Bohemian pils. Aroma of straw, hay, hay, grass, hay, bread, some lemon. Strawy-bready malty body blends really well with aromatic Saaz hoppiness. Slightly creamy mouthfeel, very strong bitterness. An impressively executed classic.
On tap, Zly Casy, Prague, Nusle, 2012/11/01. Béla velős szakvéleménye: Ogre típusú IPA.

On tap at U Chameleona. Pours cloudy golden color with everlasting white head. Aroma is malty, hay, cereal, slightly hoppy. Flavor is malty, very recognizable saaz hops, hints of citrus fruits perhaps. Overall slightly on the bitter side. Slightly dry aftertaste. Excellent pilsener.

PETka @ Kulovy Blesk, Praha. Clear, perhaps slightly hazy golden colour, large and creamy white head. Hoppy aroma. Malty backgrund, good hops with a grassy-resiny touch. Smooth and velvety palate. A good one!

Slightly darker golden yellow with decent white foam head, lasting and lacing to glass. Aroma is pleasant bitter, no sweetness present. So is taste a good bitter beer, just like it should be. Nice lasting bitter aftertaste, again no sweet flavors. (Uneticke 201210)
On draft at Prague beer museum. Pours murky gold with a big bubbly head. Grassy citrus aroma. Nicely balanced bread dough flavors with a lingering mild hop bitterness. Very nice beer.
Big white head. Clear yellow to golden. Aroma floral hops, citrus fruits, spicy, grassy. Taste light heavy bitter, same taste as aroma. Excellent lager. Finish dry bitter. Very drinkable.
Tap @ Prague beer museum. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt,grass, citrus. Flavor of malt, hay, grass, grapefruit. Medium body, soft carbonation, nice bitter finish. 060812
´Draught @ Nota Bene and Kulovy Blesk, Prague. Pours unclear golden with a white head. Bread, grass, biscuit and a floral hoppyness. Smooth and dry. Nice.

Draught at Nota Bene, Prague. Deep golden beer with a quite lasting offwhite head. Malty bready fruity aroma, hay, butter and some biscuits. Grassy hoppy flavor, biscuits, some dough, peppery, some fruits. Nice long bitter finish with spicy notes.

on tap at klub malyh pivovaru and sampled on the weekend at the zizkovske pivobrani beerfest. rich shade of golden, quite dark for a pilsner, with a persistent, fluffy head; pleasant aroma of wet metal, wet grass and wet hop flowers; some chewy malts, in a good, porridgey way, and then a fair old whack of saazy bitterness. no wonder the unetice 12 beer signs are spreading quickly around prague
Bottle from Pivonka. Great czech unpasteurized beer from Unetice. Hoppy taste, long palate and great beer.
